p: Momordica charantia (MC) is one of the most common vegetables in the tropical region, particularly in Vietnam, India, China, East Africa, Southâ€“North Asia, and Central and South America [ 38, 39]. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family and is known as bitter melon or bitter gourd ( Figure 3). Besides using MC as a vegetable, it is supposed to be a herbal medicine, used as folk medicine. Its bioactivities, such as anti-inflammatory activity, anti-oxidant activity, anti-viral activity, anti-cancer activity, anti-bacterial activity, etc. and especially anti-diabetic activity [ 40].
